action.action-desc: Mr. Petri (for himself and Mr. Butterfield) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To increase assessment accuracy to better measure student achievement and provide States with greater flexibility on assessment design.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Assessment Accuracy and Improvement Act .
Section 1111 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 ( 20 U.S.C. 6311 ) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, a State may provide that the assessments to be used to measure student achievement by that State, and by the schools and local educational agencies of that State, shall be adaptive assessments (rather than the assessments otherwise required by this Act) that accurately assess student achievement above and below grade level while also measuring grade-level performance.

For purposes of paragraph (1), an adaptive assessment is an assessment that changes its difficulty according to the performance of a student but reports the outcome of the assessment on a scale that is common to all students.
The Secretary shall ensure that the protocol for evaluating the adaptive assessments is included in peer review guidance documents.
